property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Drew Tucker

property.name: Rules
property.value: Until end of turn, if damage would be dealt to any creature, you may have that damage dealt to you instead.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The willow knows what the storm does not: that the power to endure harm outlives the power to inflict it.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Rules
property.value: For each land, destroy that land unless any player pays 1 life.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Pete Venters

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile two target artifacts.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Tervish never noticed that the amulet had vanished. It had disappeared not only from his possession, but from his memory as well.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Drew Tucker

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Cleric

property.name: Rules
property.value: {1}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Though they often bore little greater charm than the demons they battled, exorcists were always welcome in Scarwood.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Drew Tucker

property.name: Rules
property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a hunger counter on Fasting. Then destroy Fasting if it has five or more hunger counters on it. If you would begin your draw step, you may skip that step instead. If you do, you gain 2 life. When you draw a card, destroy Fasting.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Douglas Shuler

property.name: Rules
property.value: Cast this spell only during an opponent's upkeep. Creatures can't attack this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Only after the townsfolk had drawn us into their merry celebration did we discover that their holiday rituals held a deeper purpose.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Rules
property.value: Fire and Brimstone deals 4 damage to target player who attacked this turn and 4 damage to you.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jeff A. Menges

property.name: Rules
property.value: Nonwhite creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Bathed in hallowed light, the infidels looked upon the impurities of their souls and despaired."The Book of Tal

property.name: Artist
property.value: Drew Tucker

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Knight

property.name: Rules
property.value: Protection from red; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "With a great cry, the Goblin host broke and ran as the first wave of Knights penetrated its ranks."Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile all white creatures. For each creature exiled this way, its controller draws a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It is only fitting that one such as I should die in pursuit of knowledge."Vervamon the Elder

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jeff A. Menges

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Cleric

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a creature you control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Those blessed hands could bring surcease to even the most tainted soul."Sister Betje, Miracles of the Saints

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ron Spencer

property.name: Rules
property.value: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan."Tivadar of Thorn, History of the Goblin Wars

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Soldier

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. ‘Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dennis Detwiller

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Cleric

property.name: Rules
property.value: You may choose not to untap Preacher during your untap step. {T}: For as long as Preacher remains tapped, gain control of target creature of an opponent's choice they control.

property.value: Quinton Hoover

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Soldier

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Of twenty yeer of age he was, I gesse. Of his stature he was of even lengthe. And wonderly deliver, and greete of strengthe."Geoffrey Chaucer, The Canterbury Tales

property.value: Dennis Detwiller

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy all Goblins.

property.name: Rules

property.name: Flavor

When the token leaves the battlefield, sacrifice Dance of Many. At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dance of Many unless you pay {U}{U}.

property.value: Sandra Everingham

property.name: Rules
property.value: {U}: Until end of turn, if you tap a land you control for mana, it produces {U} instead of any other type.

property.value: Jeff A. Menges

property.name: Rules
property.value: {B}: Regenerate Drowned.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: We asked Captain Soll what became of the Serafina, but all he said was, "Ships that go down shouldn't come back up."

property.value: Quinton Hoover

property.name: Rules
property.value: {U}{U}: Tap target creature without flying.

property.value: Dennis Detwiller

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying {U}{U}{U}: Regenerate Ghost Ship.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below."Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tom Wänerstrand

property.name: Rules
property.value: Giant Shark can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. Whenever Giant Shark blocks or becomes blocked by a creature that has been dealt damage this turn, Giant Shark gets +2/+0 and gains trample until end of turn. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Giant Shark.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tom Wänerstrand

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan. Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Rules
property.value: When you cast this spell, counter it unless you sacrifice a land. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a land. When there are no lands on the battlefield, sacrifice Mana Vortex.

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Merfolk Assassin

property.value: Dennis Detwiller

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards they discarded this way.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Rules
property.value: As Psychic Allergy enters the battlefield, choose a color. At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, Psychic Allergy deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of nontoken permanents of the chosen color they control. At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy Psychic Allergy unless you sacrifice two Islands.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Rules
property.value: Tap all blue creatures.

property.name: Rules

property.value: Ron Spencer

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.

property.value: {X}, {T}: Banshee deals half X damage, rounded down, to any target, and half X damage, rounded up, to you.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some say Banshees are the hounds of Death, baying to herd their prey into the arms of their master.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jesper Myrfors

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

property.value: Ron Spencer

property.name: Rules
property.value: Bog Rats can't be blocked by Walls.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Their stench was vile and strong enough, but not nearly as powerful as their hunger.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ron Spencer

property.name: Rules

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Voska feared the artifact had come too easily.

property.value: Mark Tedin

property.name: Rules
property.value: {0}: If Eater of the Dead is tapped, exile target creature card from a graveyard and untap Eater of the Dead.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even the putrid muscles of the dead can provide strength to those loathsome enough to consume them.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jesper Myrfors

property.name: Rules
property.value: As Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield, exile X creature cards from your graveyard. If you can't, put Frankenstein's Monster into its owner's graveyard instead of onto the battlefield. For each creature card exiled this way, Frankenstein's Monster enters the battlefield with a +2/+0, +1/+1, or +0/+2 counter on it.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target player reveals their hand. Inquisition deals damage to that player equal to the number of white cards in their hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Many of those entrusted to Primata Delphine's care tended to express themselves with screams.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anson Maddocks

property.name: Rules
property.value: All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."Keevy Bogsbury

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Drew Tucker

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample As Nameless Race enters the battlefield, pay any amount of life. The amount you pay can't be more than the total number of white nontoken permanents your opponents control plus the total number of white cards in their graveyards. Nameless Race's power and toughness are each equal to the life paid as it entered the battlefield.

property.value: Quinton Hoover

property.value: Human Minion

property.value: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

property.value: At the beginning of your upkeep, The Fallen deals 1 damage to each opponent and planeswalker it has dealt damage to this game.

property.value: Jesper Myrfors

property.name: Flavor

property.value: Daniel Gelon

property.name: Rules

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "That was the worst experience of my days, standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

property.name: Rules
property.value: Players can't play lands. Lands can't enter the battlefield. At the beginning of each upkeep, any player may sacrifice two lands or have Worms of the Earth deal 5 damage to that player. If a player does either, destroy Worms of the Earth.

property.value: The ground collapsed, leaving nothing but the great Worms' mucous residues.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "From down here we can make the whole wall collapse" "Uh, yeah, boss, but how do we get out?"

property.name: Flavor
property.value: They attack in an orgy of rage and madness, but only one seemed as focused on killing us as the sheer joy of battle.

property.name: Rules

property.name: Rules
property.value: Green creatures have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

property.value: "Where moments before we were lost beyond hope, the strange, floating lights showed us the way and restored our morale."Vervamon the Elder

property.value: Rob Alexander

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech."Vervamon the Elder

property.name: Artist
property.value: Quinton Hoover

property.name: Rules
property.value: Lurker can't be the target of spells unless it attacked or blocked this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Each night we felt it watching us from the darkness beyond our fire. We only had one pack horse left." - Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

property.value: Anson Maddocks

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

property.value: Ron Spencer

property.name: Rules
property.value: {G}{G}{G}{G}, {T}: Regenerate target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This is his domain, and while you remain here you must value all life as you value your own.

property.value: Christopher Rush

property.name: Rules
property.value: People of the Woods's toughness is equal to the number of Forests you control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Their rain of arrows left only myself alive, cowering within a tree hollow. They did not even come out to loot the bodies."Vervamon the Elder

property.value: Drew Tucker

property.name: Rules
property.value: {G}{G}, {T}: Destroy target Aura attached to a land.

property.value: Whenever Spitting Slug blocks or becomes blocked, you may pay {1}{G}. If you do, Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn. Otherwise, each creature blocking or blocked by Spitting Slug gains first strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, a wee scratch, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone."Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

property.value: Tom Wänerstrand

property.name: Rules
property.value: {G}{G}, {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn. Damage that would be dealt to that creature this turn can't be prevented or dealt instead to another permanent or player. When the creature dies this turn, exile the creature.

property.value: If the Whippoorwill remains silent, the soul has not reached its reward.

property.name: Flavor

property.name: Rules

property.value: {3}: Target creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: For a dozen years the Cage had held Lord Ith, but as the Pretender Mairsil's power weakened, so did the bars.

property.value: {X}, {T}: Change the target of target spell with a single target if that target is you. The new target must be a player. X is twice the mana value of that spell.

property.value: Mark Poole

property.name: Rules
property.value: {3}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Runesword. If the creature deals damage to a creature this turn, the creature dealt damage can't be regenerated this turn. If a creature dealt damage by the targeted creature would die this turn, exile that creature instead.

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Choose two target blocking creatures an opponent controls. If each of those creatures could block all creatures that the other is blocking, remove both of them from combat. Each one then blocks all creatures the other was blocking. Whenever Sorrow's Path becomes tapped, it deals 2 damage to you and each creature you control.
